As is clear from Table 1, viable cell counts evidently decreased in: Examples 1 and 2 as compared with Comparative Example 1; Example 3, 4 and 5 as compared with Comparative Example 2; and Examples 6 to 15 as compared with Comparative Example 3, revealing that proliferation of the bacteria was effectively suppressed.
description.heading: [Example 16]
description.p: A blend liquid was prepared by homogeneously mixing 30 parts by mass of glycerol methacrylate, 70 parts by mass of HEMA, 0.5 parts by mass of EDMA and 0.4 parts by mass of HMPPO, and 5 parts by mass of BVI-TFSI to permit dissolution. This blend liquid was injected into a mold for contact lens made from a polypropylene resin, and polymerization was allowed using a ultraviolet ray irradiation apparatus (UV Curing System UBX0302-03 manufactured by Eye Graphics Co., Ltd.) equipped with an ultraviolet ray lamp having a dominant wavelength at 365 nm with a illuminance of about 10 mW/cm2 for about 20 min. After the lens was released from the mold, it was immersed in distilled water at 20°C, and lest to stand until reaching equilibrium swelling to obtain a soft contact lens (hydrogel).
description.heading: [Example 17]
description.p: A soft contact lens reaching equilibrium swelling was obtained in a similar manner to Example 16 using as the blend liquid a solution prepared by mixing 30 parts by mass of glycerol methacrylate, 70 parts by mass of HEMA, 0.5 parts by mass of EDMA and 0.4 parts by mass of HMPPO, and 5 parts by mass of OVI-TFSI to permit dissolution.
description.heading: [Example 18]
description.p: A soft contact lens reaching equilibrium swelling was obtained in a similar manner to Example 16 using as the blend liquid a solution prepared by mixing a solution prepared by mixing 30 parts by mass of glycerol methacrylate, 70 parts by mass of HEMA, 0.5 parts by mass of EDMA and 0.4 parts by mass of HMPPO, and 5 parts by mass of MDOA-TFSI to permit dissolution.
description.heading: [Example 19]
description.p: A soft contact lens reaching equilibrium swelling was obtained in a similar manner to Example 16 using as the blend liquid a solution prepared by mixing a solution prepared by mixing 30 parts by mass of glycerol methacrylate, 70 parts by mass of HEMA, 0.5 parts by mass of BDMA and 0.4 parts by mass of HMPPO, and 5 parts by mass of ADCA-TFSI to permit dissolution.
description.heading: [Comparative Example 10]
description.p: A soft contact lens reaching equilibrium swelling was obtained in a similar manner to Example 16 using as the blend liquid a solution prepared by mixing 30 parts by mass of glycerol methacrylate, 70 parts by mass of HEMA, 0.5 parts by mass of EDMA and 0.4 parts by mass of HMPPO, and 5 parts by mass of BVI-Cl to permit dissolution.
description.heading: [Comparative Example 11]
description.p: A soft contact lens reaching equilibrium swelling was obtained in a similar manner to Example 16 using as the blend liquid a solution prepared by mixing 30 parts by mass of glycerol methacrylate, 70 parts by mass of HEMA, 0.5 parts by mass of EDMA and 0.4 parts by mass of HMPPO, and 5 parts by mass of BVI-Br to permit dissolution.
description.heading: [Comparative Example 12]
description.p: A soft contact lens reaching equilibrium swelling was obtained in a similar manner to Example 16 using as the blend liquid a solution prepared by mixing 30 parts by mass of glycerol methacrylate, 70 parts by mass of HEMA, 0.5 parts by mass of EDMA and 0.4 parts by mass of HMPPO, and 5 parts by mass of OVI-Br to permit dissolution.
description.heading: [Comparative Example 13]
description.p: A soft contact lens reaching equilibrium swelling was obtained in a similar manner to Example 16 using as the blend liquid a solution prepared by mixing 30 parts by mass of glycerol methacrylate, 70 parts by mass of HEMA, 0.5 parts by mass of EDMA and 0.4 parts by mass of HMPPO, and 5 parts by mass of MDOA-Br to permit dissolution.
description.heading: [Comparative Example 14]
description.p: A soft contact lens reaching equilibrium swelling was obtained in a similar manner to Example 16 using as the blend liquid a solution prepared by mixing 30 parts by mass of glycerol methacrylate, 70 parts by mass of HEMA, 0.5 parts by mass of EDMA and 0.4 parts by mass of HMPPO, and 5 parts by mass of ADCA-Br to permit dissolution.
description.heading: [Evaluation of Linear Swelling Coefficient]
description.p:
After the copolymerization in Examples 16 to 19 and Comparative Examples 10 to 14, and the mold release subsequent thereto, the rate of the lens diameter when reaching equilibrium swelling at 20°C, with respect to the lens diameter in a dry state prior to immersion in distilled water was calculated, and the rate was determined as the linear swelling coefficient represented by the following formula: Linear swelling coefficient=Lens diameter after hydration/Lens diameter before hydration.
The results are shown in Table 2 below. [Table 2]
Linear Expansion Rate

Comparative Example 111.328
Example 171.276

As is clear from Table 2, it was revealed that the expansion rate in water was significantly reduced in: Example 16 as compared with Comparative Examples 10 and 11; Example 17 as compared with Comparative Example 12; Example 18 as compared with Comparative Example 13; and Example 19 as compared with Comparative Example 14.
description.heading: [INDUSTRIAL APPLICABILITY]
description.p: The ophthalmic lens of the present invention has antibacterial properties and transparency, as well as a small linear swelling coefficient in water; therefore, it is suitably used for a contact lens. In addition, use in wide variety of applications such as artificial corneas, cornea onlay and cornea inlay is possible.

claim.claim-text:
Eine ophthalmische Linse, die im Wesentlichen aus einem Hydrogel gebildet ist, wobei
das Hydrogel ein Copolymer enthält, wobei das Copolymer aus einer Verbildung umfassend (A) eine ionische Verbindung umfassend ein Kation mit einer polymerisierbaren funktionellen Gruppe und einem Fluor-enthaltendem Anion, und (B) eine hydrophile Verbindung mit einer polymerisierbaren funktionellen Gruppe, erhalten wird.

Die ophthalmische Linse gemäß Anspruch 1, wobei das Kation eine polymerisierbare funktionelle Gruppe aufweist und diese zumindest ausgewählt ist aus dem Set bestehend aus einem Imidazoliumion, einem Pyridiniumion und einem quaternären Ammoniumion.

Die ophthalmische Linse gemäß Anspruch 1 oder 2, wobei die ionische Verbindung (A) zumindest ausgewählt ist aus dem Set bestehend aus Verbindengen, die durch die nachfolgenden Formeln (I), (II) und (III) repräsentiert werden:
(in der Formen (I) repräsentiert R1 -H order -CH3; Y repräsentiert -O- oder -NH-; n1 ist von 1 bis 18; n2 ist von 1 bis 25; X1 repräsentiert ein Anion enthaltend Fluor; und RA repräsentiert ein Wasserstoffatom, -OH oder -COOH.)
(in der Formel (II) repräsentiert R2-CH=CH2, -CH2-CH=CH2 oder eine Gruppe, die durch die Formel (IV) repräsentiert wird; n3 ist von 1 bus 25; X2 repräsentiert ein Anion enthaltend Fluor; und RB repräsentiert ein Wasserstoffatom, -OH oder - COOH.)
(in der Formel (IV) repräsentiert R3 -H oder -CH3; und n5 ist von 0 bis 24.)
(in der Formel (III) ist n4 von 1 bis 25; X3 repräsentiert ein Anion enthaltend Fluor; und RC repräsentiert ein Wasserstoffatom, -OH oder -COOH.)

Die ophthalmische Linse gemäß einem der vorhergehenden Ansprüche 1 bis 3, wobei das Fluoratom-enthaltende Anion zumindest ausgewählt ist aus dem Set bestehend aus Anionen, die durch die nachfolgenden Formeln (V), (VI) und (VII) repräsentiert werden.
(in der Formel (VII) ist n6 von bis 3.)
Die ophthalmische Linse gemäß einem der vorhergehenden Ansprüche 1 bis 4, wobei die Verbindung weiter eine (C) Silikon Verbindung umfasst.
Die ophthalmische Linse gemäß einem der vorhergehenden Ansprüche 1 bis 5, wobei die ionische Verbindung (A) ein ionisches Liquid ist.

Die ophthalmische Linse gemäß einem der vorhergehenden Ansprüche 1 bis 6, wobei der lineare Quellkoeffizient in Wasser kleiner als der lineare Quellkoeffizient in Wasser der ophthalmischen Linse ist, in welcher das Fluor-enthaltende Anion durch ein Anion, das kein Fluor enthält, ersetzt wurde.

Die ophthalmische Linse gemäß einem der vorhergehenden Ansprüche 1 bis 6, wobei die Differenz zwischen dem linearen Quellkoeffizient in Wasser der ophthalmischen Linse, in welcher das Fluor-enthaltende Anion durch ein Anion, das kein Fluor enthält, ersetzt wurde, und dem linearen Quellkoeffizient in Wasser der ophthalmischen Linse vor dem Ersatz nicht weniger als 0,005 und nicht größer 0,1 ist.
Die ophthalmische Linse gemäß einem der vorhergehenden Ansprüche 1 bis 8, wobei die ophthalmische Linse als Kontaktlinse verwendet wird.

An ophthalmic lens integrally formed with a hydrogel,
the hydrogel including a copolymer obtained from a composition comprising (A) an ionic compound including a cation having a polymerizable functional group and a fluorine-containing anion, and (B) a hydrophilic compound having a polymerizable functional group.

The ophthalmic lens according to claim 1, wherein the cation having a polymerizable functional group is at least one selected from the set consisting of an imidazolium ion, a pyridinium ion and a quaternary ammonium ion.

The ophthalmic lens according to claim 1 or 2, wherein the ionic compound (A) is at least one selected from the set consisting of compounds represented by the following formulae (I), (II) and (III) :
(in the formula (I), R1 represents -H or -CH3; Y represents -O- or -NH-; n1 is of 1 to 18; n2 is of 1 to 25; X1 represents an anion including fluorine; and RA represents a hydrogen atom, -OH or -COOH.)
(in the formula (II), R2 represents -CH=CH2, -CH2-CH=CH2 or a group represented by the formula (IV); n3 is of 1 to 25; X2 represents an anion including fluorine; and RB represents a hydrogen atom, -OH or -COOH.)
(in the formula (IV), R3 represents -H or -CH3; and n5 is of 0 to 24.)
(in the formula (III), n4 is of 1 to 25; X3 represents an anion including fluorine; and Rc represents a hydrogen atom, -OH or -COOH.)

The ophthalmic lens according to any one of claims 1 to 3, wherein the fluorine atom-containing anion is at least one selected from the set consisting of anions represented by the following formula (V), (VI) and (VII).
(in the formula (VII), n6 is of 1 to 3.)
The ophthalmic lens according to any one of claims 1 to 4, wherein the composition further comprises (C) a silicone compound.
The ophthalmic lens according to any one of claims 1 to 5, wherein the ionic compound (A) is an ionic liquid.

The ophthalmic lens according to any one of claims 1 to 6, wherein the linear swelling coefficient in water is less than the linear swelling coefficient in water of the ophthalmic lens in which the fluorine-containing anion was replaced for an anion not containing fluorine.

The ophthalmic lens according to any one of claims 1 to 6, wherein the difference between the linear swelling coefficient in water of the ophthalmic lens in which the fluorine-containing anion was replaced for an anion not containing fluorine, and the linear swelling coefficient in water of the ophthalmic lens before the replacement is no less than 0.005 and no greater than 0.1.
The ophthalmic lens according to any one of claims 1 to 8, the ophthalmic lens being for use as a contact lens.

Lentille ophtalmique entièrement formée d'un hydrogel, l'hydrogel contenant un copolymère obtenu à partir d'une composition comprenant (A) un composé ionique contenant un cation ayant un groupe fonctionnel polymérisable et un anion fluoré, et (B) un composé hydrophile ayant un groupe fonctionnel polymérisable.

Lentille ophtalmique selon la revendication 1, dans laquelle le cation ayant un groupe fonctionnel polymérisable est au moins l'un de l'ensemble constitué par un ion imidazolium, un ion pyridinium et un ion ammonium quaternaire.

Lentille ophtalmique selon l'une quelconque des revendications 1 à 3, dans lequel l'anion fluoré est au moins l'un de l'ensemble constitué par les anions représentés par les formules (V), (VI) et (VII) suivantes :
(dans la formule (VII), n6 vaut de 1 à 3).
Lentille ophtalmique selon l'une quelconque des revendications 1 à 4, dans laquelle la composition continent en outre (C) un composé de silicone.
Lentille ophtalmique selon l'une quelconque des revendications 1 à 5, dans laquelle le composté ionique (A) est un liquide ionique.

Lentille ophtalmique selon l'une quelconque des revendications 1 à 6, dans laquelle le coefficient de gonflement linéaire dans l'eau est inférieur au coefficient de gonflement linéaire dans l'eau de la lentille ophtalmique dans laquelle l'anion fluoré a été remplacé par un anion ne contenant pas de fluor.

Lentille ophtalmique selon l'une quelconque des revendications 1 à 6, dans laquelle la différence entre le coefficient de gonflement linéaire dans l'eau de la lentille ophtalmique dans laquelle l'anion fluoré a été remplacé par un anion ne contenant pas de fluor, et le coefficient de gonflement linéaire dans l'eau de la lentille ophtalmique avant le remplacement, est d'au moins 0,005 et d'au plus 0,1.
Lentille ophtalmique selon l'une quelconque des revendications 1 à 8, laquelle lentille ophtalmique est destinée à être utilisée en tant que lentille de contact.
